rows.description: The intentional killing of another person by someone who has acted willfully, deliberately, and with planning and malice aforethought. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!

rows.charge: (F) | First Degree Murder of a Government Employee | CC166
rows.description: The intentional killing of a government employee by someone who has acted willfully, deliberately, and with planning and malice aforethought. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!
The attempted intentional killing of another person by someone who has acted willfully, deliberately, and with planning and malice aforethought.
Causes the death of a person with the intention of killing, but that is not premeditated or planned.

rows.charge: (F) | Second Degree Murder of a Government Employee | CC163
rows.description: Causes the death of a government employee with the intention of killing, but is not premeditated or planned.
A person unintentionally causes another’s death by an intentional act, a felony act, or acts committed during a separate dangerous felony
A person unintentionally causes another’s death through criminal negligence or while committing a dangerous misdemeanor or infraction.
Intentionally engages in physical non-consensual contact that results in harm or offense to another person.

rows.charge: (AF) | (INACTIVE) Assault with a Deadly Weapon | CC191
rows.description: (INACTIVE) Intentionally and knowingly causing serious bodily harm using or displaying a deadly weapon during an assault.
Intentionally engages in a physical act that causes another person to fear imminent harm or offensive contact.
Keeps a person in an area or restrains them for an extended time against their will.

Acts of deadly violence or intimidation intended to coerce civilians, influence government, or advance an ideology. Requires evidence of both harmful acts and political/ideological motivation. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge.
Intentionally threatening to kill or seriously harm someone else, which causes reasonable fear.
A pattern of repeated and unwanted attention, harassment, contact, or any other course of conduct directed at a specific person that would cause a reasonable person to feel fear.
Engages in a course of vexatious comment or conduct that is known or ought reasonably to be known to be unwelcome.
Engages in conduct that creates a substantial risk of physical injury or death to another person.
Steals money or property through force or threats of force from a Financial Institution or Government Facility.
Steals money or property through force or threats of force from a person or business.
(INACTIVE) Enters a property without consent and/or tampers with alarm systems.
The concealment of the origins of illegally obtained money, typically by means of transfers involving foreign banks or legitimate businesses.
Uses trusted access to steal or misappropriate funds from a private business. Fine subject to amount embezzled.
Uses trusted access to steal or misappropriate funds from a public institution or state agency. Fine subject to amount embezzled.
Found to engage in anticompetitive business practices that utilize illegal market manipulation tactics. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!
Creates false documentation, including ID cards, License Plates, Money, or Contracts.

Transports, possesses, or brings across state lines large quantities (16+) of unregistered, or improperly registered weapons/explosives. Firearm attachments will not count towards this. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!
The selling or trading of weaponry or illegal firearm attachments without a valid permit.

rows.charge: (F) | Criminal Possession of a Class 1 Firearm | CC310
rows.description: Possesses 1-5 unregistered, improperly registered, or illegal class 1 firearms. Stackable up to 3 times.
Possesses a vehicle without the consent of the owner or the legal right to possess it with the intent of permanently depriving the owner of the vehicle.

rows.charge: (M) | Theft of a Motor Vehicle | CC202
rows.description: Possesses a vehicle without the consent of the owner or the legal right to possess it without the intention of depriving the owner of the vehicle permanently.
The act of taking money or property without permission or legal right from a person or property.
The wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain.
The wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain from a business or institution.
Moves or damages a deceased individual without consent from their next of kin, or without appropriate authority from the State.
The act of deliberately setting fire to property.
Displays a weapon in public without a legally justified reason.

rows.charge: (M) | Failure to Obey a Lawful Order | CC400
rows.description: Disobeys a lawful order from a Law Enforcement Officer or Officer of the Courts.
Flees from a police officer or resists being detained or arrested.
Flees in a vehicle from a police officer to avoid being detained or arrested.
Escapes the custody of a Law Enforcement Officer or Police Department.
Escapes from the custody of the state while being held in the confines of, in transport to/from Boilingbroke State Penn, or hospitalized for intensive care. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!

rows.charge: (F) | Failure to Obey a Court Order | CC405
rows.description: Disobeys a court order. Time/fine is at Judge’s discretion.
Incites violence as part of an assemblage of three or more persons.
The gathering of people intended to disturb the peace or commit an unlawful act.
Remains in a place without apparent purpose.
Intentionally provides false testimony under oath.
Shows disobedience or discourtesy to the Court or its officers. Can be stacked.
Interferes with the discovery, arrest, conviction, or punishment of a crime.
Acts as law enforcement without appropriate authority.
Reports a false or non-existent crime.
Offers a benefit to a public servant in return for beneficial treatment.
Public servant or official abuses the authority and access of their office, through gross negligence or maliciously.
Uses threats of future physician, emotional, or other harm for personal or financial gain.
Possesses or distributes government-issued equipment. Does not include equipment legally distributed by government employees.
Enters private property without consent, or remains on private property after being asked to leave by the owner.
A prosecutor or police officer overcharges someone in bad faith. Must be pressed by a Special Prosecutor or by a District Attorney.
Hurts someone with intent to cause cruel, prolonged, or extreme pain and suffering for revenge, extortion, persuasion, or sadistic purposes.

Tortures or inflicts extreme emotional distress on the same person or group over 3+ days. Separate days must be within 10 days. Cannot be combined with CC160 for the same inflictions. A law enforcement agency does not fall under the definition of group.

rows.charge: (M) | Criminal Use of a Firearm | CC306
rows.description: Uses a firearm against someone or carries it with intent to use against someone. Also applies to projectile weapons including antique projectile weapons. Does not apply to self-defense and does not overrule any other legal use.
Any person associated with a gang, motorcycle club, or criminal group who intentionally uses force or violence against another individual based on affiliation.
Falsely represents themselves as an official of any government agency in a manner that is reasonably convincing.
As trespassing, but when the trespassed area is restricted and on government property
Possesses someone else's voter registration or uses it to cast a ballot in an official election.

Unlawfully interferes with the conduct of an official election through fraudulent, deceptive, or coercive means, including tampering with voting systems, dissemination of false information, intimidation of voters, or obstruction of voter access. Voter Fraud alone does not constitute Election Interference.

rows.charge: (F) | Conspiracy to Commit Election Interference | CC415
rows.description: Willfully conspires with others to unlawfully interfere with the conduct of an official election through fraudulent, deceptive, or coercive means. Cannot be combined with Election Interference. Voter Fraud alone does not constitute Election Interference.
Consumption, purchase, or possession of alcohol by any individual under the age of 21.

rows.charge: (M) | Furnishing Alcohol to a Minor | CC122
rows.description: Sells or furnishes alcohol to someone under the legal drinking age of 21. If found guilty, results in the revocation of liquor licenses of involved individual(s) and associated organization(s).
Commits Battery against an LEO during the lawful execution of the LEO's duties. Must be used in place of Battery when appropriate.

rows.charge: (F) | (INACTIVE) Aggravated Battery against an LEO | CC192
rows.description: (INACTIVE) Committing battery against an LEO that results in serious injury or involves the use of a deadly weapon while the officer is engaged in lawful duties.

rows.charge: (F) | Attempted Murder of a Gov. Employee | CC160
rows.description: The attempted intentional killing of a person who is employed by the government.

rows.charge: (I) | Negligent Ownership of a Firearm | CC304
rows.description: Fails to exercise reasonable care in securing, handling, or using a firearm.

Transports, distributes, or cultivates large quantities of illegal substances. For this crime, large quantities are considered 200g+ marijuana, 4+ marijuana plants, 200g+ methamphetamine, 100g+ of Cocaine, or 19+ doses of other prescriptions or controlled substances. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!
Tampers, conceals, removes, or transports evidence of a crime that can be used by Law Enforcement or the Courts to detain, arrest, or prosecute a person/s.
Possesses any amount of explosive devices, excluding fireworks, whether operational or not.
Any person associated with a gang, motorcycle club, or criminal group who discharges a weapon against another individual based on affiliation.
Takes a person against their will and abducts them without consent.
Flies over restricted airspace without authorization (e.g., Boilingbroke State Penn., Fort Zancudo, military aircraft carrier).

rows.charge: (I) | Negligent Operation of an Aircraft | AC551
rows.description: Operates an aircraft in a way that is considered negligent. Comes with a free review of your pilot's license by licensing officials!

rows.charge: (M) | Reckless Operation of an Aircraft | AC552
rows.description: Operates an aircraft in a way that is considered reckless. Temporarily suspends Pilot's License until licensing review.
Operates an aircraft without permission from the owner or lawful right to operate the aircraft.

rows.charge: (F) | Kidnapping of a Gov. Employee | CC173
rows.description: Takes a Gov. Employee against their will and abducts them without consent. Gov. Employees include DOJ, DAO, PDO, SASP, Rangers, and SAMS.
Throws, places, or propels an explosive into, against, or upon any real or personal property or uses an explosive device against a person/s. Excludes fireworks.

Creation of or possession of equipment to manufacture weapons (firearms and explosives). Equipment is considered a weapon manufacturing tool in addition to materials and weapon parts. This is a Hold Until Trial Charge!

rows.charge: (M) | Criminal Possession of Weapon Attachments | CC305
rows.description: Possesses 1-4 illegal firearm attachments (e.g., suppressors, extended magazines).

rows.charge: (F) | Introducing Contraband into a Gov. Facility | CC417
rows.description: Introducing, attempting to introduce, or possessing items that are considered contraband within a correctional facility.
When 2 or more persons join together and form an agreement to violate the law, then act on that agreement.
Intentionally and voluntarily participates with another in a crime by encouraging or assisting in the commission of the crime.
(INACTIVE) Intentionally and voluntarily participates with another in a crime by encouraging or assisting in the commission of the crime.
Takes one or more steps towards the commission of a crime.
(INACTIVE) Takes one or more steps towards the commission of a crime.
A utility charge to release an individual on bail until their trial date.
A utility charge to remand an individual to DOC custody until their trial date.

(INACTIVE) Aggravating factors include targeting public servants or government employees, the crime occurring in or around State buildings (hospitals, prisons, police stations, city hall), and for non-violent crimes, the use of deadly weapons.
Travels at excessive and reckless speed - greater than 35 mph+ over posted speed limit.
Driving a vehicle faster than legally allowed on a given road or highway.
Fails to come to an appropriate stop at posted signs, intersections, and traffic control devices.
Drives without due care and attention.
Has window tint that obscures the view of the driver or passengers. Excludes government vehicles.
Fails to operate a vehicle in a proper lane of travel, or passes in a dangerous manner.
Driving, operating, or being in control of a vehicle while impaired by alcohol (>0.08 BAC) or drugs.

rows.charge: (I) | Operating a Motor Vehicle without a License | HC508
rows.description: Operates a motor without a valid driver's license in possession.

rows.charge: (M) | Operating an Aircraft without a License | AC553
rows.description: Operates an aircraft without a valid pilot's license in possession.
Parks outside of a designated space.(e.g., on/blocking a crosswalk, blocking a driveway, on the sidewalk, occupying multiple spots, etc)

rows.charge: (I) | Violation of Disabled Parking Provisions | HC510
rows.description: Parks in a space designated for disabled persons without a permit.

rows.charge: (I) | Failure to Yield to Emergency Vehicles | HC511
rows.description: Fails to pull to the side of the road to allow an emergency vehicle using lights and/or sirens to pass.

rows.charge: (I) | Failure to Display License Plate | HC512
rows.description: Fails to display an unobstructed view of a rear valid license plate. A vehicle may not be towed for this infraction alone.
Disrupts or stops the flow of traffic.
Follows another vehicle at an unsafe distance.
Participates in a race with a motor vehicle without a proper permit.
Causing a disruption or nuisance in a public space that bothers others. Must be weighed against social benefits and rights.
Permits a passenger to travel inside the trunk or storage space, or in an otherwise unsafe manner of their vehicle.
Drives while wearing a headset, mask, or earplugs covering both ears of the driver.
Operates a vehicle that is not roadworthy, including excessive smoke/fumes, missing doors, damaged brake lights, bald or deflated tires, damaged headlights, etc.
Fails to pay the appropriate parking charges for a metered parking space.
Operates any vehicle not authorized for travel on a public road or walkway (e.g., golf carts, go-karts, rock loaders, lawnmowers, aircraft).
Participates in hunting or fishing without a license.

rows.charge: (M) | Hunting/Fishing with a Suspended License | RC701
rows.description: Participates in hunting or fishing with a suspended license.
Inflicts deliberate harm, neglect, or abuse upon animals without legal justification.
Inflicts deliberate death upon animals without legal justification.
Deliberately chases, disturbs, or provokes wildlife, disrupting natural habitat.
Participates in hunting or fishing in a protected area.

rows.charge: (M) | Hunting Outside a Permitted Area | RC707
rows.description: Participates in hunting outside a permitted area.
Participates in hunting while using a weapon other than the designated standard equipment, such as a hunting rifle.
Possesses up to 10 illegal (protected) species of fish or wildlife.
Possesses more than 10 illegal (protected) species of fish or wildlife.
Causes damage or destruction of park flora including grass, bushes, and trees, resulting in environmental harm or defacement.

rows.charge: (I) | Non-display of an Official Inspector Grade | HS450
rows.description: Operating a state-inspected and graded eatery, bar, or business without displaying an Official Inspector Grade of Health and Safety in a designated location.

rows.charge: (I) | Noncompliance with a State Operations Code | HS451
rows.description: Repeated noncompliance with health and safety standards set by the San Andreas Department of Public Health, not rectified on inspections.

rows.charge: (I) | Unauthorized Excessive Modification of a Gov. Building | HS452
rows.description: Unauthorized construction or modification of a government-leased building, assessed for structural integrity and public safety standards.

rows.charge: (F) | Unauthorized Construction Hazardous or Offensive | HS453
rows.description: Unauthorized construction that is hazardous or offensive to the public, assessed by the Department of Public Health.
Any condition deemed hazardous to an individual's health due to negligence, ignorance, malice, or other reasons.
Any physical obstruction to public safety or condition hazardous to operations, endangering physical safety due to negligence, ignorance, malice, etc.
Fails to follow the terms of a written or verbal contract.
Acts without due care or attention, causing damage to people or property. The defendant must have breached a duty they had, and that the breach caused the damages.
As negligence, but within a license profession.

A false statement about a person, that is communicated to a third party, where the defendant is at fault for at least negligence, and damages are suffered by the plaintiff's property, business, reputation, or profession. Statements about public officials require actual malice.

rows.charge: (CS) | Tort: Infliction of Emotional Distress | CS804
rows.description: Acts intentionally or recklessly in an extreme or outrageous manner to cause severe emotional distress through negligence or intent.
Intentionally damaging or destroying property.

rows.charge: (M) | Possession of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC100
rows.description: Possess any amount up to 28g of Marijuana, any amount up to 5 Marijuana seeds, any amount up to 10g of Methamphetamine or any amount up to 10g of Cocaine. Possesses prescription medication or other controlled substances without a prescription.

rows.charge: (F) | Felony Possession of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC102
rows.description: Possess more than 28g of Marijuana (1-3 Plants), more than 5 Marijuana seeds, more than 10g of Methamphetamine or more than 10g of Cocaine. Possesses 7+ doses of prescription medication or other controlled substances without a prescription.

rows.charge: (F) | Sale of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC104
rows.description: Sells or Distributes a Controlled Dangerous Substance without legal authorization or licensing.

rows.charge: (F) | Imprisonment of a Gov. Employee | CC171
rows.description: Holds a Government Employee in an area or restrains them for an extended period of time against their will.
The fraudulent acquisition and use of a person's private identifying information.

Any individual who is intoxicated over the legal limit of 0.08% while in public and behaves in a manner that is reasonably disturbing to the public/public space, or is a hazard to themselves or others.
Flees from a motor-vehicle accident without identifying themselves to the other party involved in the accident.
Flees from a motor-vehicle accident that results in serious injury.
Tending to 1 or more marijuana plants.

rows.charge: (F) | Theft of a Gov. Vehicle | CC218
rows.description: Steals a Government Owned vehicle without the legal right to possess it. Government owned vehicles include police vehicles, fire trucks, ambulances, and military vehicles.
Attempts to cause the death of a person with the intention of killing, but that is not premeditated or planned.

rows.charge: (F) | Production of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC105
rows.description: Actively produces or attempts to produce a controlled dangerous substance with the proper medical licenses. [Methamphetamine, Cocaine, Marijuana, Prescriptions, Other Controlled Substances]
Fails to appear in court without a justified reason. Time/fine is at Judge’s discretion.
Monthly License Fee for standard trapping license. Permits up to 15 fishing traps and up to 5 deep water crab traps. The may be charged multiple times to pre-pay for additional months.
Uses traps with the intent to catch game and fish without a license
Fee of their cost per trap, engraved by SAPR
Using traps that have not been registered with the SAPR with the intent to catch game and fish
Fee to recover hunting license
Fee to recover a concealed carry license
Abandons property in San Andreas parks, beaches, territories, or trails over 25kg. Abandoned hazardous or toxic waste in any amount.

rows.charge: (I) | Over Maximum Hunting/Fishing Limit >50 Over | RC715
rows.description: Possesses more than 50 but less than 100 hunted animal meat or fish over the (50-piece-limit) on person and/or vehicle

rows.charge: (F) | Over Maximum Hunting/Fishing Limit >100 Over | RC716
rows.description: Possesses more than 100 hunted animal meat or fish over the (50-piece-limit) on person and/or vehicle

rows.charge: (F) | Attempted Mass Murder of Government Employees | CC167
rows.description: The attempted intentional killing of 5+ persons who are employed by the government. This includes SASP, SAMS, DOJ, DAO, and Rangers.
Intentionally engages in a physical act that causes another person to fear imminent death OR commits assault while using a deadly weapon.
Intentionally engages in a physical act that causes severe bodily harm to another person without the intent to kill OR committing battery while using a deadly weapon.

rows.charge: (F) | Felony Battery against an LEO | CC155
rows.description: Commits felony battery against an LEO during the lawful execution of the LEO's duties. Must be used in place of felony battery when appropriate.
Entering a property without consent or legal right in order to commit a crime.
As burglury, but entering a government property, financial institution, or occupied dwelling.

Disabling security systems, bypassing locks, or interfering with protective measures without the owner's permission. Includes tampering with alarms, surveillance equipment, and access control devices on private or public property
As theft, but a property value of 20000+ dollars. Does not apply to Theft of a Motor Vehicle, Vessel, Aircraft, or Grand Theft Auto.
Depositing waste in an inappropriate location
Operates a seaworthy vessel without permission from the owner or lawful right to operate the vessel.
Intentionally damaging or destroying government property.

rows.charge: (M) | Operating a Motor Vehicle with a Revoked license | HC521
rows.description: Operates a motor vehicle while a license is revoked.

rows.charge: (F) | Operating an Aircraft with a Revoked license | AC554
rows.description: Operates an aircraft while a license is revoked.

rows.charge: (M) | Operating a Boat with a Revoked license | BC600
rows.description: Operates a seaworthy vessel while a license is revoked.

rows.charge: (I) | Operating a Boat without a License | BC601
rows.description: Operates a seaworthy vessel without a valid boating license in possession.

rows.charge: (F) | Criminal Possession of a Class 2 Firearm | CC311
rows.description: Possesses 1-5 unregistered, improperly registered, or illegal class 2 firearms. Stackable up to 3 times.

rows.charge: (F) | Criminal Possession of a Class 3 Firearm | CC312
rows.description: Possesses 1-5 unregistered, improperly registered, or illegal class 3 firearms. Stackable up to 3 times.
Performs regulated professional activities, without the proper license

rows.charge: (M) | Operating a Business without a License | CC655
rows.description: Operates a business without the appropriate licenses
Urinating or defecating in public that is unwelcome, disturbing, or vandalizes property.

rows.charge: (M) | Misuse of an Emergency Line | CC358
rows.description: Uses an emergency line without proper cause.

rows.charge: (F) | Interrupting a Scheduled Court Case | JC953
rows.description: Interrupting a scheduled court case, causing it to be continuanced or otherwise disrupted in an extreme manner.
Shows disobedience or discourtesy to the Court or its officers. Can be stacked.
Fee to recover fishing license
Inflicts deliberate death upon a domesticated animal without legal justification.
Commission of Assault against the plaintiff. Damages occur based on severity and cause of assault.
Commission of Battery against the plaintiff. Damages occur based on severity and cause of battery.

rows.charge: (CS) | Tort: False Imprisonment and Kidnapping | CS807
rows.description: Commission of the illegal restriction of liberty or movement against the plaintiff.
An unreasonable, unwarranted, or unlawful interference with another person's private use and enjoyment of his or her property. Must be weighed against social benefits and rights.
Intentionally going on land that belongs to someone else or putting something on someone else's property and refusing to remove it.
Intentional unlawful taking or damaging of another person's personal property without the owner's permission.
Maliciously abusing the court system, such as excessive and unfounded civil filings or abusive appeals, causing economic or emotional damages to individuals.

Publicizing private affairs without legitimate public concern OR wrongful intrusion into a person's private activities OR releases private records inappropriately. Public areas grant no expectation of privacy.
Commits fraud against the plaintiff.
An individual or group violating constitutional rights, enumerated or otherwise. Not used in conjunction with other civil statutes.
